channel.title: physics on Project Delve
channel.description: Recent content in physics on Project Delve

item.title: LHC@Home
item.description: “LHC@Home” View the project here. Overview The Large Hadron Collider @ Home project from CERN is a volunteer computing project that uses Internet-connected computers to advance Particle and Accelerator Physics. Participate by downloading and running a free program on your computer. Runs on: Linux MacOS Windows

item.title: Radioactive@Home
item.description: Radioactive@Home View the project here. Overview Radioactive@Home is a polish science project using distributed computing capabilities of BOINC platform. The main goal of the project is to create free and constantly updated map of radiation available for all people, by gathering information about gamma radiation using using sensors connected to computers of volunteers willing to participate in the project. The project uses dedicated hardware sensor; without it the app does nothing and no credits are granted.
